page.title: 07Education
page.content: Hornby Primary School serves the area under study and provides education for pupils between five and eleven.The school has 74 pupils on roll and they belong to one of three classes within the school. There is an Infant class, a Lower Junior class and an Upper Junior class staffed by one part-time and three full time teachers. The pupils enjoy a full and varied curriculum and many take part in after school activities. The present school building has been occupied for 22 years. Hornby County Secondary is one of the smallest in the country, having some 140 pupils on roll. The pupils are drawn from a wide rural area, often coming from very small primary schools. The curriculum is not as extensive as larger schools: several part time teachers are employed to provide more choice for GCE and CSE exams.
